name: W.Box

values.name: cinemascopeRatio
values.comment: Sets aspect ratio for the box as 21:9. This is the default ratio for cinema screens.

values.name: class
values.comment: Pass in extra classes. Note: these styles might conflict with W.Box's own styles.

values.name: classList
values.comment: Pass in extra classes using conditionals. Note: these styles might conflict with W.Box's own styles.

values.name: flex
gap
values.comment: Gap size in "rem".

values.name: height
values.comment: Height in "rem".

values.name: heightCustom
values.comment: Pass in a custom height value.

values.name: heightFull
values.comment: Sets height as 100% of relative container.

values.name: heightRelative
values.comment: Height in "%". Values should be 0.0 to 1.0.

values.name: heightScreen
values.comment: Sets minimum height as 100% of screen size.

values.name: id
values.comment: Pass in extra CSS styles. Note: these styles might conflict with W.Box's own styles.

values.name: node
values.comment:
Customize the node you want to use to render your element.

    W.Box.view [ W.Box.node Html.section ] [ ... ]
values.type: (List.List (Html.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Html.Html msg) -> W.Box.Attribute msg

values.name: size
values.comment: Set width and height in "rem" at the same time.

values.name: squareRatio
values.comment: Sets aspect ratio for the box as 1:1.

values.name: styleList
values.comment: Pass in extra CSS styles. Note: these styles might conflict with W.Box's own styles.

values.name: view
values.type: List.List (W.Box.Attribute msg) -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Html.Html msg

values.name: viewButton
values.type: List.List (W.Box.Attribute msg) -> { onClick : msg, content : List.List (Html.Html msg) } -> Html.Html msg

values.name: viewLink
values.type: List.List (W.Box.Attribute msg) -> { href : String.String, content : List.List (Html.Html msg) } -> Html.Html msg

values.name: widescreenRatio
values.comment: Sets aspect ratio for the box as 16:9. This is the default ratio for video embeds.

values.name: width
values.comment: Width in "rem".

values.name: widthCustom
values.comment: Pass in a custom width value.

values.name: widthFull
values.comment: Sets width as 100% of relative container.

values.name: widthRelative
values.comment: Width in "%". Values should be 0.0 to 1.0.

name: W.Skeleton

values.name: circle
values.comment: Makes the skeleton element a circle with the specified size in "rem".

values.name: height
values.comment: Sets the height of the skeleton element in "rem".

values.name: noAnimation
values.comment: Disables the animation of the skeleton element.

values.name: radius
values.comment: Sets the border radius of the skeleton element in "rem".

values.name: relativeHeight
values.comment: Sets the height of the skeleton element as a percentage of its parent element.

values.name: relativeWidth
values.comment: Sets the width of the skeleton element as a percentage of its parent element.

values.name: view
values.comment:
-- skeleton with default size
    W.Skeleton.view [] []

    -- skeleton with custom size
    W.Skeleton.view [ W.Skeleton.width 100, W.Skeleton.height 100 ] []

    -- skeleton with custom size and no animation
    W.Skeleton.view [ W.Skeleton.width 100, W.Skeleton.height 100, W.Skeleton.noAnimation ] []

values.name: width
values.comment: Sets the width of the skeleton element in "rem".

name: W.Styles

values.name: borderWidth
values.comment:
Default border width in pixels.
This value is used for things like input, select boxes and other elements.

values.name: clickArea
values.comment: Default size for clickable inputs such as checkboxes and radio buttons.

values.name: clickAreaSmall
values.comment: Default size for the small variation of clickable inputs such as checkboxes and radio buttons.

values.name: customTheme
values.comment: Use a custom theme. Please refer to georgesboris/elm-theme package for a complete documentation.
values.type: { theme : W.Theme.Theme, darkMode : W.Theme.DarkMode } -> W.Styles.Attribute msg

values.name: darkTheme
values.comment: Use a basic dark theme.

values.name: lightAndDarkTheme
values.comment: Use a basic theme with light or dark modes set based on user preferences.

values.name: lightTheme
values.comment: Use a basic light theme. This is the default behavior.

name: W.Table

values.name: bool
values.type: List.List (W.Table.ColumnAttribute msg a) -> { label : String.String, value : a -> Basics.Bool } -> W.Table.Column msg a

values.name: column
values.type: List.List (W.Table.ColumnAttribute msg a) -> { label : String.String, content : a -> Html.Html msg } -> W.Table.Column msg a

values.name: float
values.type: List.List (W.Table.ColumnAttribute msg a) -> { label : String.String, value : a -> Basics.Float } -> W.Table.Column msg a

values.name: groupSortWith
values.type: (( String.String, a, List.List a ) -> ( String.String, a, List.List a ) -> Basics.Order) -> W.Table.Attribute msg a

values.name: groupValue
values.type: (String.String -> List.List a -> Html.Html msg) -> W.Table.ColumnAttribute msg a

values.name: groupValueCustom
values.type: (a -> List.List a -> Html.Html msg) -> W.Table.ColumnAttribute msg a

values.name: int
values.type: List.List (W.Table.ColumnAttribute msg a) -> { label : String.String, value : a -> Basics.Int } -> W.Table.Column msg a

values.name: labelClass
values.comment:
Pass in extra classes for a column label.
This can be useful for when you want to conditionally hide sorting icons unless the user is hovering a table header.

An example using tailwindcss:

    W.Table.string
        [ W.Table.labelClass "group"
        , W.Table.labelRight
            [ div
                [ class "opacity-0 group-hover:opacity-100" ]
                [ .. ]
            ]
        ]
        { .. }

values.name: maxHeight
values.comment: Max height in "rem".

values.name: string
values.type: List.List (W.Table.ColumnAttribute msg a) -> { label : String.String, value : a -> String.String } -> W.Table.Column msg a

values.name: view
values.type: List.List (W.Table.Attribute msg a) -> List.List (W.Table.Column msg a) -> List.List a -> Html.Html msg

name: W.Text

values.name: fontSize
values.comment: Customize the font size using "rem" as unit. This way the font size is always related to the base font size of the html element.

values.name: letterSpacing
values.comment: Customize the letter spacing using "em" as unit. This way the letter spacing is always related to the current font size.

values.name: lineHeight
values.comment: Customize the line height using "em" as unit. This way the line height is always related to the current font size.

values.type: List.List W.Text.Attribute -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Html.Html msg

values.name: viewInline
values.type: List.List W.Text.Attribute -> List.List (Html.Html msg) -> Html.Html msg
